Reviews.Title: “Lying staff, overpriced, small rooms, horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: RJ R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Art by the Spanish Steps was horrible. The staff was nasty. I asked if I could by chance get the complimentary upgrade due to being a member of Small Luxury Hotels, hotel clerk lied and I was told we already were. The room CLEARLY was not an upgrade. It was about 8x10, with just a small stand up shower, cracked bathroom tiles. Later, another hotel person confirmed we did NOT get the upgrade. The girl told us that was because my travel agent did not provide her with my Customer ID number for the Small Luxury Hotel club or provide any notes when booked. I happened to have the paperwork which included the customer ID number (lie #2), so she was caught lying too. We were told by a 3rd lie by the 3rd hotel rep we asked for help (his name was Ferdinando, I insisted on getting his name, none of them wore nametags, so I was finally smart enough to demand his name) we could either get an upgrade that night, or if we waited we'd get a suite the next night. Since we were going to Florence the next day, we opted for the Suite upon our return. When we returned from Florence, we were NOT moved into the suite, but into a slightly larger room. If we'd know that was going to be the case we would've moved the night before. We asked a hotel staff where a particular restaurant was, he said, "I don't know, never heard of it". He had a computer next to him, he could've at least looked up the address and let us know, we're good at following maps. So, overall the staff was dishonest, rude, and did not help with anything. So disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously small rooms; but comfortable and great location!”
Reviews.Author: BernieD_Chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I was just reading other reviews of this hotel before I post my own. One commonality I notice among many reviews: the rudeness of the front desk staff and the small rooms. The front desk staff is not particularly helpful or friendly. There are so many wonderful, friendly people in Rome. I would fire these front desk clerks and get people to better represent the hotel. Although they weren't overtly rude to me, they were cold and unfriendly. It's true the room was painfully small, but the bed was comfortable, the internet very strong, and I did like the bathroom. The location is fantastic...down a small, quiet street lined with art galleries in a very chic part of town. It's a quiet little corner of Rome to escape and relax after a day plying through hordes of people sightseeing. The team who serves breakfast was fantastic (Breakfast was delicious, by the way. Lovely assortment of fruits, cheeses, juices and wonderful coffee). The wait staff was extremely attentive and polite. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again. You don't spend much time in your hotel room in room, and I found the experience overall to be quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, let down by staff”
Reviews.Author: jjswlg
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the location of Hotel Art and the lobby (an old church) is great. However the rooms are rather small, and the staff were rude and unhelpful. Upon checkout, I was overcharged for mini bar and laundry, I felt like a criminal and had to wait for five minutes to get the bill reprinted. The incorrect laundry wasn't changed and to save mucking around further I jus paid it. The biggest shock was the breakfast staff - breakfast opens at 7am, but we had a taxi then. The area was fully set up and I asked a staff member if I cold quickly grab a box of muesli, he grumbled but agreed. Upon sitting down I started to get abused about messing up his area and that the rules are the rules! Not a great feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ralph2178
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a super location. rooms are a bit small but very modern. the hotel is very boutique and in the nicest alley way close to the spanish steps

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: GrantDSmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Art by the Spanish Steps as part of a group tour. Location is fantastic - so central to so many things in Rome. Staff were average and not all that helpful. Rooms are quite small and shower not so good. Amazing reception area and restaurant that was once an old church. Great entrance to hotel and awesome first impressions let down by size of rooms. Not sure if I would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller room in Italy”
Reviews.Author: CAIOMEN
Reviews.Content: The small room was a big surprise. The reception staff very rude. Breakfast staff was quite gentle. The room was so hot , hitting was dificult to operate.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice place but not as good as it once was.”
Reviews.Author: RCK52
Reviews.Content: For many years, we have stayed at the Hotel Art by the Spanish Steps on business and family trips to Rome. The hotel is near the Steps but located on the very quiet and charming Via Margutta about 200 meters from the center of the tourist scrum. The rooms are not big but nice. The hotel provides a lovely breakfast in the morning and has a pleasant bar space for drinks in the evening. For a longtime, the bar was presided over by Maurizio, a charming guy who seemed to speak a dozen languages and made the best martini in Europe. Maurizio is now gone. The Hotel Art is still nice but it has not kept up with the times. The wifi connections, for example, are nonexistent in the rooms and barely functioning in the lobby area. The business center charges a signficant fee for internet connections and then does not always deliver consistent access. The fitness room is small and barely functional especially by the standards of most modern hotels even in Rome. I still like this hotel a lot and will probably continue to stay there despite missing the advice of Maurizio and being annoyed by the above concerns. However, I will also start to shop around for another spot that has the same advantages without these small but important annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting choice, however...”
Reviews.Author: DCoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Art for 4 nights in room 208. The location is great, it's near most major attractions although the colosseum and forum is about a 40minute walk. There are plenty of nice restaurants nearby down the various alley ways and the hotel staff can give some good suggestions. When we checked in we were confronted with a rude man, he did not tell us anything about the hotel, breakfast ect. No one offered to take our bags, we were handed the key card and sent on our way... not what you would expect for the cost of staying at this hotel. The room is small, maintenance is needed (there were large cracked tiles, a/c doesn't work, the shower is VERY ANNOYING to use and much more) Not to mention the fowl smelling incense sticks which we immediately had to remove from the room! On the positive: at our second visit to the reception we met a much more helpful man who told us everything the other didn't and gave us some fantastic dinner recommendations. We can't remember his name (Francesco??), however, he was youngish and had a shaved head! The rooms are kept very clean and tidy with a turn down service. Overall the stay was disappointing, as we were expecting Hotel Art to be a place of fantasy. Ohh were we wrong. If you go to Hotel Art not expecting the best you will probably leave satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Regretted choosing this hotel for my birthday treat!”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach06
Reviews.Content: Wanted to spend some quality 'me' time on my birthday and chose this hotel. Booked 3 nights and almost wanted to checked out of it the moment I checked in - too bad I had prepaid the room! Arrived at the hotel at 7am after a 13 hours flight and as usual, room was not ready. The front staff was not sympathetic at all and just brushed me off that room was not ready and that i should check again at 11am. I finally got into the room at 12.15pm. The room is pathetically small and the furnishing is nothing to shout about. The bed is uncomfortable and the blanket was made up by stacking two thin sheets together! Air-conditioning was controlled by the front desk - can you believe that? And for no reason when I was still in the room, they just turned off the air-conditioning in the morning! I have to call them several times to get them to turn it back on! I will not return to this hotel and will certainly not recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent stay; would definitely visit again”
Reviews.Author: shinobirastafari
Reviews.Content: We paid for the cheapest room, but I think we received an unrequested free upgrade (we stayed in Room 205), as the room felt bigger than advertised, and there was a full soaking tub. A little annoyed at how stiff the mattress was and the fact that they pushed two beds together to form the double bed, but that's a Roman thing, and hardly unique to the hotel. We still got a great night's sleep. We were advised that the internal air conditioning controls didn't work, so if we wanted any adjustments to the temperature, we should call the front desk. But we were checking in during late October, so temperature wasn't an issue. Query if things would have gone so well in August, but anyone who visits Rome in August already knows they're taking their chances, so I'm not docking any points. The style is very modern, and makes some bold design moves. But you should know that by now if you visit the website at least once, so can everyone stop complaining about the color scheme, already? What was far more important to me was that the concierge was in good humor when he checked us in. He took care to recommend a number of different restaurants to us, and the one we chose was excellent. And the concierge was also very cool about responding to my e-mails requesting a restaurant reservation the last second before we checked in. He was very kind in explaining that the restaurant was closed on Sundays, and so he wasn't able to accommodate our reservation request. And he said it with grace so I didn't feel like the dopey American I was, so kudos for that. The bar / cafe staff were also very friendly, and the hotel's dining area itself is a comfortable place to relax after a long day of walking. Finally, we took advantage of the breakfast spread, and it shouldn't be missed. They provide extremely high quality breakfast options, and large portions at that. OK, and finally for real this time, the place is extremely well situated in the Spanish Steps area, but it's tucked away in an alley, so our room was extremely quiet with respect to outdoor noise. All in all, we were thoroughly satisfied. We'll definitely consider staying here again the next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marianne N
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, but the rooms are very small. We had two rooms. Standard and superior. We could not tell the differences. The staff claimed superior room was bigger. We could not tell..Air conditioning did not work and it was very difficult to take a shower. Female receptionist was not very welcoming. Would expect more of a five star hotel. Breakfast buffet was good. Concierge was very helpful. Arranged a guide for us and recommended a great local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything we were looking for. The location is perfect close to the maint sites and yet on a quiet street. The rooms are clean, well equiped and the staff quite curtuous. A special thank you for Juan Carlos, the barman, who went out of his way to recommend restaurants, to make the reservations for us. We had some great evenings thanks to him. We will certainly be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel art”
Reviews.Author: ErynK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (hopped off our cruise ship and wanted an extra night in Rome). We researched hotels and found hotel art was by the Spanish steps. Great location, beautiful hotel, clean rooms (very spacious for Europe). The bed was very comfortable and our window opened into a very modern courtyard. Each floor was a different colour and lit up when you walked down the hall. We were on the yellow floor. I would definately recommend art hotel and look forward to staying here next time I'm in Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location trade off for small room”
Reviews.Author: minniePrincess
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small but sensational location in leafy and quiet margutta, feels almost like a sanctuary from the masses of tourists. Great buffet breakfast , best I've had in Italy so far. Service typical Italian standard but all in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: Crumbles1991
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this trip for a birthday surprise & I have to say, he made a great choice by booking this hotel. It's down a quiet side street & the entrance to it is so pretty. The hotel itself has polite, helpful staff & is decorated beautifully-you can tell much thought has gone into the design & the detail is exquisite (the reception pods are a bit odd though!) We stayed on the 3rd floor, with our room located above the walkway to the hotel entrance, so although you don't get a view as such, it's still very pretty looking out of the window. The room itself, while not the biggest, was certainly more than adequate & incredibly clean. It was a little cold & I don't think you could alter the temperature, although, this was appreciated when getting back from a hot day of sightseeing in August! The lighting is, shall we say moody - not ideal for doing make up, put it that way! The bathroom was spotless, with a great shower & bathrobes are available to use. the bed & pillows took some getting use to - although, that's probably just me, as my husband does accuse me of being a bit 'goldilocks' too soft, too hard. I'd highly recommend this hotel, great location, just a stones throw from the Spanish Steps & Trevi fountain & with breakfast included with a great selection to choose from, personally speaking, you can't go far wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay very much”
Reviews.Author: lamchin
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this hotel surprises you in stages. The first entrance off the charming cobblestone street leads you down a path that has tiny white lights embedded in the stone wall. The front doors open automatically, and you enter the lobby to be greeted by a blend of modern lighting and traditional architecture. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included, and there was a lovely assortment of fruit, yogurt, cheeses, meats and breads. The room was small, but very clean, quiet and comfortable. There was a small fridge with snacks and drinks if you want to pay for them. Internet access is not free, so I didn't try to use it. The location is very convenient; the day we arrived, we walked to the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, and the Trevi Fountain. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 3chances
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the breakfast brunch was open early which gave us a great start for site seeing. We were on the orange floor "3rd" rm#302 nice size for Europe but it was on the same side as the front walk way which some nights were noisy but that was other hotel guests not all nights were like this. Anyway the hotel had a great location on a side street main streets at are very busy and loud with locals and visitors. The room has thin walls for an afternoon nap but over all was not too bad. Make sure you do now how the trains work if you decide to travel to outside of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a tourist weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lynnhughes67
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely decor, very modern. The rooms are small but cover all your needs - so clean they sparkle. Great relaxed breakfast and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary rooms , hit and miss service !!”
Reviews.Author: oakman1
Reviews.Content: Went here for a very special occasion , but the hotel did not live up to our expectations . The hotel site photos of course make it look fantastic , but you soon realise the rooms are not filled with bunches of flowers or coloured cushions , and are very basic , decorated in the style of a functional plain business style hotel room . The only colour is in the bathroom , good fixtures but lots of cracked and broken tiles , 15 in our bathroom , if it was my own house they would have been replaced years ago , the hotel, it seems, is not bothered. The air conditioning is only controlled by reception , our room was hot and stuffy in the night but we could not cool it down as they would not turn the system on , and we had to ask to have the heat on when we were too cold ; for 250 euros a night I had expected to be allowed to have the temperature as I wanted in the room ! The bed linen was wonderful though , changed daily , and the bathroom worked well though in need of a refurbishment ; and anti slip mat in the bath/shower. The public spaces are not up to much , think so much more could have been done with the space , the pods used for reception look cheap , like something left over from a music festival , the seating area is okay but not so great at breakfast , which was wonderful , a great selection of food ! The service was very erratic , a concierge who was happy to do everything with a smile , to a girl who very begrudgingly checked me in online for a flight , "as long as no other guests need serving , and there is a business centre you can pay to use as well " it took her all of 5 mins , and she was doing nothing any way ! On leaving the doorman refused to let us get in the cab for 5 minutes as it was not the hotel's driver , they were actually standing in front of the cab doors to block us , after much arguing they allowed us to use the cab , not a great way to say goodbye . The hotel is in a great location, and this is it's strong point , the coloured corridors are fun for the 10 seconds you are walking through them , otherwise it is a Travelodge type hotel with great breakfasts and good bedlinen !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, bathroom and bedroom on top of quiet and very good service”
Reviews.Author: Stephane64186338
Reviews.Content: Perfect location bathroom and bedroom on top of quiet and very good service

Reviews.Title: “Great location from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chezza1962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Art Hotel in December 2010. The hotel is in an excellent location just a couple of blocks walk from the Spanish Steps, with taxis, train station, restaurants and the major shopping streets of Via Condotti and Via del Corso all just a short walk away. The hotel is in a quiet, charming street lined with art galleries. Our room was small but modern with all the amenities you needed however two small annoyances....shower fitting was broken so could not fix the shower head up high (but it could be hand held so not a huge issue). Also, we could not seem to turn the air conditioner either down or off, so needed to keep the window open all night to avoid roasting in the room. Staff were helpful but not overly friendly, breakfast reasonably good although the coffee was poor. Overall though a good hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, basic rooms with no view”
Reviews.Author: voyageur81
Reviews.Content: cant beat the location in a private side street right off Spanish steps. wants to be hip and chic design but misses the mark . the bedroom furniture is unispired. Could be a novotel or best western if it were not for the modern bathroom fixtures and lights. Bedside Lights on construction wires , impossible to adjust for reading without burning fingers in the process, rooms are tiny and overlook a smallish courtyard. can hear bathroom noise from neighbor. overpriced for what it is. All the extra are expensive (internet at $9.00 a day for instance.)

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st time stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: twinklec28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Art from 10/17 – 10/22. We had checked in early and found that our room was not ready yet. So they held our bags for us and we came back 2 hours later to check into our room. We had room 309, the orange floor (each floor of the hotel has a unique color) We had a superior room, which was spacious. The bathrooms were on the small size, but it was manageable. Hotel Art is a luxury boutique hotel and has a great history as it used to be a monastery. Throughout the hotel, there are works of art on display. The concierge service was outstanding. They went above and beyond with helping us with restaurant recommendations, and museum reservations etc. We truly loved our stay here. Our room was cleaned in a timely manner everyday. Our stay included a free breakfast, which included eggs, bacon, various fruit, cheeses, cold cuts, pastries, juices, coffee, and tea. This is extremely helpful and cost saving. The location was very central as were just about 3 short blocks from the Spanish Steps. The street that the hotel is located is on a very quiet small street which is nice as you do not hear all the city noise of Rome. Overall we would recommend Hotel Art to anyone looking for a great small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, gracious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amhjr
Reviews.Content: With so many choices in Rome it was difficult to arrive at a decision, but an online booking engine proposed this hotel at a great rate and we gave it a shot. We were installed on the "blue" floor... the elevator hall, the bath tile even the soap in the bath, were blue themed and I assume the red and yellow floors get equal treatment. The room came with a hotel transfer and our flight was several hours late but the driver was there waiting for us and could not have been more pleasant. Likewise the hotel staff were always gracious and friendly, full of advice and seemed genuinely concerned that we were were enjoying Rome. The hotel arranged two guided tours for us and the service / experience / value were impeccable. Breakfast is among the best I have had in any European hotel. We deiced to stay again after a trip to Sardinia and even though the hotel was advertising it was fully booked, the staff accommodated us with a room and at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Top class and very elegant hotel, plus an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HeilijgersJakarta
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be among the top 5. It is very elegant, new, and the design is very very special. The hotel itself is already a piece of art. The breakfast restaurant is very relaxing, with big lounge chairs instead of the usual high uncomfortable dining chairs, good to enjoy a relaxing morning coffee and the good inclusive breakfast. The hotel has a top location, anything you want to see in Rome is at easy walking distance . The main shopping area is round the corner, as are many bars and restaurants. The "Spanish steps" are 100 meters away. We travel around the world a lot, both for business and pleasure, and we mostly don't like the typical tourist hotels, but we found this hotel a real gem. That is why we could not understand some of the negative comments made by some writers to tripadvisor. We went through the guest book and 99% of all comments written were very positive. Perhaps some writers who experienced a problem used tripadvisor to vent their frustration. One writer wrote about that he could not sleep because of a crying baby next door and faulted the hotel of giving him a room next to a family with a baby. Sorry you cannot blame the hotel for a crying baby. We anyhow found the rooms very well isolated and quiet. Another one complained a bout the air condition. We had no problem, temperatures could be adjusted to anything we liked. But this writer also told that more guests had this problem, so i guess that their might have been a technical problem. In that case the hotel should have told this and give the guest a discount. The hotel is not cheap, perhaps twice the price of the cheap tourist hotels around the termini train station, but still half the price of the big chain hotels, but with double the elegance. We found the hotel real value for money. Rooms are not big, but reasonable and very well equipped and decorated. If you prefer a bit more space book a suprior room. Everything you need is in the room, a plasma TV, internet with a remote keybord. Normally the pictures on a website of a hotel are better then what you see if you arrive at the hotel, not in the art hotel, this looked even much better than the pictures on the website. We can highly recommend this place. But if you only look for a place to sleep, and do not like to pay a bit more for an elegant, very special sophisticated place, then you better go to one of the many cheap hotels around the termini station...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and cozy”
Reviews.Author: nedasanandaji
Reviews.Content: great location +beautiful interior design I truly enjoyed my stay.The hotel is located in best barrio(for me)of Rome.Meanwhile it is walking distance from all the action situated in a beautiful pergola like street. This hotel would not be a good choice for people who are used to traditional large hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very arty!”
Reviews.Author: turtlez
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful location. It is on a quiet side street filled with art galleries and interesting buildings, yet it is only a block from all the action near the Spanish Steps and the elegant shopping of the Via Veneto area. The staff was helpful, the inside of the hotel was unique and stylish, and the breakfast was delicious. Our room was small (but we expected Rome hotels to be small) and stylish---actually the lighting was too stylish to be practical. We could have used more overall lighting as there was only one window in the room. The bathroom was well-outfitted and had great amenities. And above all, the bed was very comfortable. It's not inexpensive, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, recommended for Art History lovers”
Reviews.Author: kieletaitano
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Art was not only convenient for me, shopping wise, but also very intriguing to stay in. The hotel used to be an old Church, and the architecture, frescos, and vaulted ceilings say it all. The bartender downstairs in the lobby even gave me a copy of how it used to look! The rooms were comfortable and fascinating. The rooms used to be a dormitory for the seminarians. The space was modern yet comfortable, with a touch of the rich blue color everywhere. The staff was polite and the bed was comfortable. The food there was good, too. Overall, my stay was very enjoyable, and I will definitely return for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Puts new meaning to a green floor in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zaem
Reviews.Content: We were stranded during the Icelandic volcano. Hotel Art gave us a fair price for a very nice room on their green floor. The room was clean, the hotel was great, the breakfast was lunch as well, the staff were all gracious and very knowledgeable. My only complaint was that the room was very warm due to an early spring and there was no AC turned on yet. My husband's only complaint was that you could not leave the hotel in any direction without walking past a designer retail establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: HOLLY213Florida
Reviews.Content: This seminary turned hotel is ultra modern with all the bella Italian bathroom fixtures. The breakfast buffet is delicious with an extensive selection of pastries, fresh fruit,and much more. It is a convenient location for all the tourist spots and great restaurants. Located in the art distrist so art lovers will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: DVG59
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in a quiet little street near the Spanish Steps. Very trendy. The rooms are nicely disigned, bathrooms are bightly coloured, looks great (for a couple of days at least). View from our room window was a wall but well hidden behind nice curtains, and who cares? You should be out in the city! Very good breakfast, high quality food, great coffee and good service. Although the breakfast room might be a little bit more 'intimate" more separated from the reception area. Lies in one of the best parts of Rome, which is one of the best cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Art lovers will love this hotel - very funky!”
Reviews.Author: hunta2
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Hotel Art - took me a little while to find it as the transfer driver dropped me at the Spanish Steps and then pointed in the direction I was to walk - not extremely helpful but he said only small taxis could fit down the lane where it was - not bigger transfer vans. I eventually found it and it is a very funky boutique hotel. My room was very small but it was only me in there so was okay. The hallway leading up to the room had sensors when you walked into the hall, it lit up and being on the "green" floor the halls lit up to be a bright lime green. My room had a one -off piece of artwork in it (as do all the rooms) and a single bed. The bathroom was very cool with great ammentities and lots of little spot lights. Shower was great and nice and bright with yellow mosaic tiles. I had a view from my window into the below courtyard which had some great arty furniture in it. The tv doubles as a computer and the best thing was, as I wasn't travelling with a laptop, I could use the internet in my room and it was 5 euro for 24 hours which was great value. Word of warning - use this access as if you go to the business centre below to use internet, I paid 16euro for 45 minutes as first night my internet in the room was down. Staff are helpful enough but not excessively friendly. Breakfast was good and the waiter there was quick to offer tea/coffee in the morning which was good. Overall, loved the hotel as it was unique and a 3 min walk to Spanish Steps and lots of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NataschaR
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks very nice and is trendy and beautifull. We think it is too expensive for what you get. The room is nice and modern but small. The breakfastroom is also the restaurant (small choice) and the chairs are trendy but you can not sit on it a very long time. Drinks in the hotel are very expensive. Its located in a quit street so thats nice. We had a very nice time but we would not stay here again because for the money you can get more.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique Hotel, Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLaw
Reviews.Content: Our family of three including our 12 year old son just returned from a two week trip to Italy. During our stay in Rome, we were lucky to have stayed at the Hotel Art. The location of the hotel could not have been better. Hidden on a very chic side street, the Hotel Art was so convenient, quiet,minutes away from the Spanish Steps and close to the best shopping in Rome. The hotel is very contemporary, comfortable, warm and spotlessly clean. The staff was sophisticated, friendly and accomodating. We stayed in a two room suite. The beds, pillows and linens were top shelf. The bathroom was a little small and the tub and shower were tricky to get in and out of as the were elevated. There was plenty of room for unpacking and two televisions.The Hotel Art graciously complimented our room with a very elablorate fruit basket that was refilled each day. The breakfast was delicious and was served all morning until 11:00. They charged 6E for a Coke at the bar which I felt was ridiculous but we found a little store a block away that had liters of Coke for 1.5 E which made our son happy. The Hotel Art was a great find and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel with Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: Turtle9275
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully situated hotel steps from the Piazza de Spagna and Piazza de Popolo on the quiet Via Margutta. Easy access to the Metro line and walking distance to many of the important tourist sites. The Hotel is as much of an art exhibit as it is a hotel. Hotel staff is willing to assist with all your needs and goes out of their way to make your stay most enjoyable. Recommendations provided for dinner were outstanding. Nice European Breakfast each morning with fresh fruits, meats and beverages of your choice. Great first stopping spot during a trip!

Reviews.Title: “Has gone down, not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: a711n
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel once for our last stay. We just got back from Rome and my husband and I stayed at Hotel Art for a week. The service is not the same, their attitude has changed and they are not friendly. The staff are the same as our last stay but they have an unfriendly attitude, the hotel owns one wine opener, the guy at the bar had to come and open our bottle of wine and take the opener with him. The staff don't go out of their way to do somehting for you, when you ask them a question or request information they don't really want to do it, they look like they are pushing themselves. This experience was with the older staff, there were couple of new people which were much nicer and friendlier. The aircondition gets shut off from the front desk, I called from the room to ask them to please turn the air off, they didn't, after five minutes I called again and they guy in front says when I'm finished with what I'm doing I will turn it off. Most the hotels in Rome have breakfast included, so don't get excited about their breakfast, the breakfast used to be great but it's not as good of a quality as it used to be. At the last night of our stay, I requested an address to an Osteria which we had been before, he writes the address down on a post it and I kindly requested to show me where it is in the map and he responded he doens't exactly know where it is, without even asking or wanting to find out. We requsted for a scale to weigh our luggages before leaving, they said we only have two scales which are in our two suites, after an hour and my husband's effort they gave us the scale. It's the little things which make your stay very special. We had to wait for everything, call a few times and they made us feel like if they do somehting for us after our secound call, they are doing us a major favor. You would think that a four star hotel has to give you a good service more than one wine opener and two scales. Overall the service is just okay, the mojority of staff besides the bell man and two of the new people are just very unfriendly, lazy and their attitude is very poor, I wouldn't stay there again. We go to Europe and especially Italy once a year and this was not a good experience at all, I call it an extremely average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel within among history in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Hins
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay last week, was pleaseantly surprised at the efficiency and good service at a design hotel. The location is perfect, just few block down the street from the Spanish Steps, it's hidden behind the main shopping street so it's actually quiet. I have the blue floor where the hallways and the bathroom are all bright blue. The hotel gave me an upgrade to a suite, so it's nice to see a bigger room. Bath tub is nice and deep, and all toiletries are from Etro. Breakfast is very good. Overall is a good modern hotel that has great location, and you'd like it if you are interested in a modern hotel while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: poysoniv
Reviews.Content: The location is really good-tucked away in a pretty alley right by the spanish steps. The hotel room was large and very comfortable and very clean. The service was great- they were all very attentive to our needs. The breakfast was also very good. They have very tasty cappuccinos. Some reviews mentioned that the walls are thin and you can hear people in other rooms- this is true . Overall, i would stay here again. It's a nice boutique luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: donnerkebab
Reviews.Content: Having trawlled the internet for a top class hotel that fitted my meagre salary I decided upon the Hotel Art. First impressions were good and on arriving in the quiet side street behind one of romes most exclusive shopping districts we were greeted by a smiling and helpful concierge, the receptionist however needed a bit of coaxing to break a smile and the POD staff were helpful and courteous if more stiff than the POD itself. The bedroom was adequate and comfortable and definitley compact , if this was a superior twin the twin must be a cupboard. The bathroom(no bath) was also small and once again style took the place of functionality with a fancy shower head that pointed most places but down. The walls had funky green glass wall tiles three or more of which were cracked, the toilet cistern required a bit of fiddling to stop the water constantly running and the finishing around the shower door was unprofessional. The rooms and hotel were spotless and the housekeeping team were most cheerful and immaculatley dressed a real credit to them. Breakfast was very good with a large selection and the courtyard was very relaxing. The fitness room would be as well closed as it want open either of the two days we were there a complete waste of space(in my opinion) The staff at breakfast were all very nice and attentive. I would reccommend this hotel for its excellent location and i know that quality in any capital city comes at a premium but the operators of this hotel seem to belive that corridors on each landing of different colour neon type lights make it somehow special and this is probably the worst hotel gimmick as far as a usp goes that i have ever seen this is just Art for Arts sake. I had also notified the hotel that i was bringing my daughter here to celebrate her eighteenth birthday and not a mention was made a simple happy birthday on arrival would have been nice, less preening and more customer focus! All in all i enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Art and will possibly use it again, it is four star but in essence its just a jazzed up travel lodge at a higher cost.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ulysseys
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Art Hotel twice, once in 2005 and once in 2006, and both visits were very good. There are lots of good things about the Art hotel but the location is definitely one of the highlights. It is literally a 5 minute walk to the Spanish steps but because you are one road removed from the main street the hotel is actually quiet and secluded, while at the same time being right in the middle of things. My second favourite thing was the breakfast. They have an extensive breakfast and everything was high quality. I have had worse breakfasts at better, or at least higher ranked, hotels. Décor is also a plus. The entrance to the hotel is down a long outdoor hallway and then you walk into the lobby. The outside courtyard is very well done and the indoor lobby is also a great place to just relax and have a drink. Staff was actually very friendly. If I sound a little surprised it's because my experience at most Roman hotels has not been so good. But I found the staff both helpful and friendly really going out of their way to help out. OK so what's the downside? The only downside is that the rooms are small -- and I mean they are small (makes the rooms at the W Lexington in New York look like mansions). The bathroom is particularly tight. But they are very clean and the beds were comfortable and the room was cool in the summer when I stayed there and warm during my winter stay. Perhaps the other downside is that the work-out facilities were also a little small. Good equipment though, really quite new and they had a steam room which was nice. But no more than 2 people in the steam room. And you really couldn't have more than 4-5 people in the gym, tops. Personally the room size did not really bother me. We were too busy seeing the city and shopping to spend a lot of time in the room. And I am of the opinion that when I am in a place like Rome I prefer location, and cleanliness to room size. But if you need a big room (ie you may be a little heavier than your ideal weight) you may want to look elsewhere. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Rome. You really cannot beat the location, and the place has a great feel to it with friendly staff and a great breakfast. If you are staying for a long period of time (more than a week) the room size might bother you but if it's for 3-4 nights it shouldn't be a problem. I got use to it pretty quickly and the hotel has so many other benefits that you really don't even notice after awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ditya6um
Reviews.Content: A very different hotel with very helpful staffs. The location is great, every night you can walk down to Spanish Steps and enjoy the fountain and the music and the atmosphere over there. The size of the room was good from European standard. It did not have the bath tub but the shower was good. The best thing about the hotel is the breakfast, which has tons of variety - from cereal to omlette to fruits to breads to croissant to juice to coffee/tea and many more. We absolutely loved this hotel! Staffs are helpful - I needed a scale to weigh my luggage and they made it available for me within 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Restful, and Welcoming for first time international travelers”
Reviews.Author: amyindallas
Reviews.Content: We loved the design. I would call it "high end modern." The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was smaller than what I generally expect to find in Texas, but to me it was a nice reminder that I was overseas. The space was well-planned and functional. The fixtures and color had such a sleek feel to them, I was like a kid in there just turning things off and on to see how they worked. Loved the breakfast, too, and I found the concierge to be extremely helpful. They had taxis at the ready only moments after our request. And my biggest thank you to the concierge is their help on my train situation. I thought I had reservations on a high-speed train to Florence, but as it turned out, I had missed a final step on this. Not being able to speak Italian, I could not straighten this out. The concierge spent quite a bit of time researching my options and describing our wishes and needs. It so eased my mind to have help taking care of these details. Thank you, Hotel Art! We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Need earplugs for neighbor's toilet flushing, but a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLuxtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Art is on one of the most charming streets in all of Rome, cobblestone surrounded by art galleries and cafes. It is tucked away in a neat enclave five minutes from the Spanish Steps and great restaurants. As you walk down the cobbled entryway, a little difficult to pull roller luggage on, you enter a uber-modern lobby with high bar against the wall. The colors are vibrant and bold, each floor its own fluorescent orange or electric green for example. The concierge was helpful, but not warm and friendly. Sometimes, they even appeared aloof and annoyed. On to the room, it is all high-tech with internet on the tv, with the most un-useful keyboard ever! UGH! It was small, they said they had none with a view, so we faced the interior courtyard. It was fine at first, functional. Then the NOISE BEGAN! You can hear the room next door flush the toilet!!! Yes, the toilet. You can hear the hum of conversations ALL night. When guests are in the hallway, you can hear clearly the conversations. The walls are paper thin and the guests were young and partying all night, came home and had more parties in the hallway. We barely slept, and even in the morning heard so much noise as people were getting ready to leave their rooms. Anyway, if you are deaf, it is a great place to stay. One plus, the breakfast buffet is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Nice Staff!! but Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anne1985
Reviews.Content: I always like to stay in modern design hotels and this one was a good choice! Location is ideal just 2 min away from the Spanish steps. Hotel is really well furnished with modern lobby and modern rooms. The only downside is that our room was on the small side.. maybe rather small. But very good layout i must admit. Anyway you don't spend much time in your room when you are in Rome! Breakfast was really excellent and the staff at the reception were really helpfull. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_Traveler999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights, my first trip to Rome (although she had lived in the city before). Hotel Art is in a great location - on the Via Margutta, a quiet back street that contains a few shops and some nice restaurants, but very close to the Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo, Villa Borghese, etc. We walked most places - the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, and even Vatican City (although that was a hike). Easy enough access to the metro at the Spanish Steps, though. So - great location, quiet in the middle of the big city. The hotel itself is gorgeous, a renovated church, I believe. Our room was spacious for European standards, and very modern. We stayed on the Piano Verde, or Green Floor. The staff was competent, and we had drinks in the courtyard at night - a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “'Different' decor!”
Reviews.Author: Karen2704
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and 3 children) and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August 2008. The location is great, very central, and on a quiet back street. We were suprised that the hotel had been listed as one of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World (we have stayed in others) since we did not rate the service, room refinements and especially the en-suite bathroom. The hotel is somewhat 'wacky' in it's decor and generally unconventional, being a mixture of minimalist and weird, but extremely colourful! The breakfast selection was good and included in the room rate, however we found the hotel generally overpriced. Next time we'll try somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a city stay”
Reviews.Author: CalFlyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Art hotel for a weekend stay, with my wife and another couple. I was pleasantly surprised by the great location (only few steps from the Spanish Steps, in a quiet side road). The hotel is generally clean and well maintained. The breakfast, which was included in our Expedia-rate, is much better (more choice) than you would normally expect in Italy. The room is functional, a firm bed, a modern bathroom. There is a gym in the basement, with a cycle (broken), a stepper, and a running machine. Overall, it feels like a 4-star hotel. A little expensive at €220, but then again it is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Amptone
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great for our family. We booked a Quad room that had a king and a double bed, each in its own room. The rooms are set up with a sliding door for privacy. The bathroom has a double sink and overall there is more room than a typical Rome hotel, plenty for the four of us. Hardwood floors and windows that open help to make you feel more at home. This does not have a chain hotel feel to it. Everything was very clean and the room temperature was not a problem. The hotel staff went out of their way to help us, ordering cabs and suggesting restaurants. There was even a bowl of fruit and a bottle of Champaign awaiting our arrival. The room came with a buffet breakfast that was very good, the best we had during our Italian trip. Many choices of pastries, meat and cheeses, as well as eggs, bacon and sausages. The atmosphere is definitely different; it couldn't be more contemporary if it tried. Makes for an interesting stay and my kids loved the colorful floors. Why travel out of the country to stay somewhere boring? The location is fantastic. Only a block and a half away from the subway and the Spanish Steps. Very close to all the shopping you could ever want, and many restaurants as well. Pretty much everything in the city is walkable or easily accessed by the train. The street was quiet and lined with art galleries. We spent a couple of hours just enjoying the local art scene by walking up and down the street. If pressed to give a complaint, it would only be the price, we dropped over $900US per night on the room. If you can swing the cash, however, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, small hotel in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Lottie001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Art a couple nights in Rome before and after a cruise. Both times I was lucky enough to get a room on the green floor, which is easier on the eyes than the yellow or orange floors (the top floor, the blue floor, doesn't hurt the eyes); however, on both occasions my room was not ready until about 15-20 minutes after the check-in time. In the interest of full disclosure, I was traveling with a girlfriend whose room was ready (both times) prior to check-in time. Go figure. The rooms are nice and simple, and a great size for a Roman hotel. While the lighting is less than perfect in the bedroom (there are several small lighting fixtures rather than a bright overhead) the bathroom is lighted well, and includes a hair dryer. As a previous reviewer mentions, the hotel has hardwood floors so it can be more noisy than a hotel with carpeting, however, I thought the only noise problem was people out late in the courtyard smoking and laughing. The temperature of the room is controlled by the Hotel, however, you can call down to the lobby to have the temperature adjusted. I had mine lowers to 23 C without issue. You may want to note if you open the windows, the air automatically shuts off. The staff is very helpful, and very friendly. In fact, once you check in they hand you a map of Rome and circle the hotel. They are able to recommend local restaurants, and tips for taking a taxi around town. They also recommend some walking trips & guides in the city which I would definitely look into next time I am in Rome. In addition, they offer a car service for a fee which is quite comparable to other local liveries. It is worthwhile to book a room which includes breakfast which is a very good buffet spread: many different fruits, cereal, toast, muffins and danish, several juices, bacon, eggs, sausage, salamis, cheeses, yogurts, coffee, expresso, et al. The Hotel is located very near the Spanish Steps, however, off a side street so surprisingly quiet considering its closest to one of the busiest sites in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: coachkatie
Reviews.Content: We are an older couple in our mid 60's and loved this place because of the closeness to a lot of the sights. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The restuarant staff was GREAT!! They were always so friendly. The rooms were a bit small, but if you read about a lot of the European hotels you'll find this is true in a lot of them. When we go to Rome again, we will definitely stay here. James and Katie Littleton Victoria, TX

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever”
Reviews.Author: EBest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Art by the Spanish Steps for 5 nights while on our honeymoon. First, you CANNOT beat the location. The hotel is in an alley (pretty, not creepy) that's about a 2 minute walk from the Spanish Steps. Somehow, the hotel is perfectly quiet and comfy despite the activity only a block or two away. The room was beautiful and plenty big. How much time do you spend in your room anyway? The bed was very comfortable. I actually got stomach flu/food poisoning while we were in Rome and the room was large enough for me to be lying on the floor of the bathroom miserable while my new husband slept peacefully in bed. It was over 100 degrees almost every day that we were in Italy, but you would never know it from the hotel room. The a/c was great and we were kept as cool as we wanted - at least while we were inside. The breakfast that is included with your stay was wonderful. Lots of fresh fruit, cheese, meats, juices, pastries, etc... to chose from. The staff was wonderful!! The front desk crew was amazing - always giving us little tips and pointers about where to eat or grab a drink. Very, very helpful. We loved this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay while in Rome. We LOVE this hotel and will probably stay there every time we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: TravelHappy876
Reviews.Content: The is a 'wanna be' chic designer boutique but it doesnt really pull it off. Strip away the 'egg shell' reception , ok dining area and luminous paintwork in the hallway and you are really left with little more than a basic 3* hotel. The place is very well located a couple of minutes from the Spanish steps. It is clean and comfortable, and the breakfast is decent. But those simple plus points do not warrant the 5* prices. The room size was disappointingly small, and the bathroom even smaller (approx 6ft by 6ft). Our shower was tiny; I am slim and I only just fit in. The bathroom had no bath tub, and I confirmed with other friends in other rooms, that none of their bathrooms had a bath tub either. Ironically they do provide a courtesy spa bath foam ! They do not provide iron and ironing board in the rooms, claiming that it is a fire hazard. But I suspect the real reason is that it would be difficult to fit the ironing board in the room. To get something ironed, you must use their laundry service instead, but be warned that this is only open Monday to Friday. Room was very stuffy with little air circulation, and the temperature control seemed to be broken. We had to leave the window open every night. Comparing with friends who stayed at other hotels, there are much better places with bigger rooms and at a much lower cost. Unless you think its worth paying 100euros a night over the odds for a luminous yellow painted hallway, then I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveTait
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lot of fun and really grew on us while we were there. The decor is "high modern" in the public areas. The floor halls are wildly colored. It is all a lot of fun. If you are looking for a traditional hotel look elsewhere. The room was a bit small but the space was well designed. The staff were helpful, friendly and professional. The location is great, right near the Spanish Steps on a quiet beautiful side street. The hotel breakfast buffet, which was included, was one of the best I have ever had anywhere in the world. The rooms have limited Internet access through the TV. We needed more access for some work and the hotel has a computer with internet access available at a cost which was pretty steep but it worked well. There is also a small gym. All in all very comfortable for a city hotel. We booked throug Expedia and prepaid our stay which made it much more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and exquised”
Reviews.Author: quay5043
Reviews.Content: At the Hotel Art you will see one of the most beautiful hotel you have ever stayed in. the Hotel Art is in the heart of the city right next door to the Spanish steps and is stones throw away from the Trevi Fountain one of Rome's main attractions. the hotel is in a side street . You would expect to be very loud being next door to a main attraction but your wrong. the hotel is very peace full at all times when you stay at the hotel you will experience something that you have never experienced before. the hotel is devided into 4/5 colours, the colours include blue, green, yelow, orange and red. The floors are bright and illuminating and the walls are lit up and shows great art which the name of the hotel. The food there is excellent including breakfast which is always fresh and you never see anything cold it is prepared at your order. Dinner is excellent with different menu's including Italian,Western and Asian food which shows great variety. When you enter the hotel you feel as if you have just walked into an art museum or art gallery. The rooms are spacious which can easily fit 3/4 people in a standard room. You have a lot of space and the bathroom is large including your bath,shower and other facilities. You enter your room as if it is being displayed at the Art gallery and nothing at the hotel is old everything is modern. Negatives: Nothing Just enjoy the experience at the Hotel Art.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially good but falls short with small basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wantseverything
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with another couple for a city breck without children. The location was good with easy access to the designer shops. The area was quiet at night in November so we had to walk for some atmosphere as the hotel bar was empty as well. The rooms are small and feel basic, not worth the money. The staff were helpful and the hotel was different. However I would stay in a different area next time.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY,SMOKY,MGMT RUDE AND JUST A WASTE OF MONEY”
Reviews.Author: rickyroberts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent FOUR terrible nights in this Hotel. We were subjected to a suite that it was very small for the price, reaked of cigarette smoke and had someone elses hair in the bathroom We moved to another room and it wasnt much better. There check in office is a big egg, I guess for some people they might think its chic but its very cold and non appealing. The food was cold and I wont go any farther. Oh I forgot to mention when you call or ask anyone who works for the Hotel how do you get there heres there answer. Just get to the Spanish Steps and tell the cabbie take me to the Hotel of the Arts. As if its a landmark, you would be better off asking for the tooth fairy to take you there. Sounds good, but our cabbie didnt know where it was. Nor did 7 business owners, 2 other cabbies and a policeman. We finally had to call and someone came to find us. We were not more that 300 feet from there building. Italy is a great country and we had a great time and look forward to going back. We will bypass this Hotel. Where your sunglasses in the hallways rather bright in color. Forgot to mention it was very hot and we found out that you cant control the Air Conditioner from your room. They do it individually from the front desk egg. It was very warm in the room and all they would say is we have it turned down all the way. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE SAVE YOUR MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irene_20
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is fabulous! It seems to me like a gem in the heart of Rome. I have never had such a pleasant experience in my life. The rooms are maybe a little bit small but have all facilities that a guest can wish: big bed, fine linens, internet connection, central heating, well ecquipated bathroom with everything in it! The staff very nice and willing to help us . The breakfast is served in the lobby in a romantic atmosphere and includes everything: fruits, yoghurts, cheese, pastries, scrubled eggs, sausages, salamini italiani, cakes, different kinds of coffees. We stayed at Art Hotel during the Christmas and I sincerely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dacqaroo
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Rome and it was thanks to Hotel Art. We were in the best location for shopping, site seeing and restaurants. The rooms were clean and modern and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They advised us where to eat and every suggestion they made was sensational. I wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"wannabe designer" hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffeebar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Art has a magnificent location and a very attractive entrance. from here on everything is a bit pathetic. why? couse it tries so hard to be like London's hotel Sanderson or Paris's hotel COSTES-K .. reception is the most pathetic: they are working in 2 big "eggs", and it looks sad, not hip. i booked one of hotel Art 2 suits - and it was terrible - 2 very tiny rooms, no space and very badly lit. i changed to a delux room which was an open space plan so had mor space and felt less cloustrophobic. the bathroom was all orange (?) and the shower had nice water pressure. the lobby and patio are philippe stark wonnabes and are, again, emberesing... and not inviting or cosy at all. i guess that if you are a young traveller with little experiance, you would find hotel Arts "happaning", but if you stayed at places like "sanderson", "st martins lane" or hotel Costes you will fill that this is, by no way, the real thing.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Art”
Reviews.Author: bjfrank
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our our honeymoon to Italy. The first leg of our journey was Rome and we stayed at the Hotel Art. They automatically upgraded our room before we even arrived, and the entire stay was terrific. The front desk staff goes above and beyond, to serve their guests and are always available to provide directions or restaurant suggestions. The breakfast was perfect, and hit the spot every morning before heading out to see Rome. Also, the hotel is on a very quiet side street so you never hear the traffic outside. The decor of the hotel is different and not what you would expect for a hotel in Rome, but we loved it. I would highly recommend Hotel Art, and would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable designer hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rachelli
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. On our third trip to Rome we were unable to book the previously much loved Hotel delle Nazioni, but the dissapointment was shortlived when we arrived at this hotel. Ultra modern and very intense decor that you will either love or hate, it is probably best to ask upon booking if you would prefer to be on the soothing 'green floor' instead of the passionate 'orange floor'! The hotel is on a quiet cobbled street just a block away from the Spanish Steps, which makes it lovely and private while still being incredibly close to the sites of Rome. The included breakfast in our stay was typical continental fare, with breads, yoghurts and cereals and not too much else, but we did feel that we had value for money overall, especially as our seven year old stayed free with us at the time. The only thing about the hotel that we felt could use a little improvement was the friendliness of the staff, although I can't say anyone was ever impolite, it was more a feeling of being only just nice enough and no more. The rooms themselves are not huge but are certainly comfortable and not poky compared to European standard, although if you are used to spacious American hotels you will probably feel a little cramped. None of this was much of a detraction for us however, as the hotel is so conveniently located, it is easy to stay out late and simply stroll back in the evenings. If you are one to stay in the hotel a little more, they do have a lovely outdoor garden sitting area and although we didn't use it, it did look very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights recently. The hotel is ultra modern in decor with painted hardwood floors in the corridors. The downside to this ultra modern appearance is that the lack of carpets in the hallways and rooms creates more noise than would be the case with carpeted hotels. My initial room overlooked the hotel's internal courtyard where there are some seats where guests can have a drink during the night if they wish - it was a little bit noisy so I asked to be moved and was. The room I was moved to was reasonably quiet. I was able to sleep in this hotel after I was shifted to another room and I am a light sleeper. The noise in the corridors was a little bit annoying, and I would have preferred less corridor noise, but it was relatively quiet during sleeping hours i.e. 11pm to 8am as there is obviously little activity during those hours. There is no individually controlled air conditioning in the rooms - if you want the temperature raised or lowered you have to call down to the front desk. This was not a big issue as the air conditioning worked well and was lovely and cool, but I would have preferred individually controlled air conditioning. I was very impressed with the staff at the front desk who were very friendly and helpful without being pretentious in any way. In fact, all the staff were great at this hotel and work very hard to please the guests. This is a 4 star hotel so it is not as expensive as the 5 star Hotel de Russie [where the cast of Ocean's 12 stayed when they were in Rome] or the Westin Rome. The Hotel Art has an impressive ultra modern entrance and appearance throughout and the breakfast buffet was great. I wasn't blown away by this hotel, due to reservations about the noise in the corridors due to lack of carpet in the corridors, but this hotel was ok for the price. I can't complain. Hotels in Rome are very expensive and this place was very modern and well located. I expected 4 star and I got it and I liked the hotel's ultra modern "cool" appearance. The hotel is in a good location right by the Spanish steps. The guests at the hotel were fairly upmarket - the place is not cheap so that is what you would expect. Next time I go to Rome I think I would go for a more traditional hotel - perhaps the Intercontinental de la ville or one of the hotels on the Via Veneto but I did not have a bad stay here. The buffet breakfast is particularly memorable with a lovely atmosphere in the large breakfast room at the entrance of the hotel and lovely food. Better still it was included in my room rate. I've rated this hotel "Average" because of the noise in the corridors but it would be "Above average" otherwise, as the staff and appearance of the hotel were great.

Reviews.Title: “How did I end up here?”
Reviews.Author: Yogmart
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Art in april '07. It is an amazingly Modern Hotel in an amazingly Historical City. I had booked the Empire Palace Hotel and on arrival they said they were double booked and could we stay in their "sister Hotel" which was Hotel Art. We decided to have a look and see if we liked it. We were amazed by the decor in the Hotel when we got there, it was like the Hotel was in the wrong City. The Hotel is very well decorated throughout and had a very calming effect when entering from the hustle and bustle that is Rome. Some of the Reviews complained about small bathrooms but we stayed on the luminous Yellow Corridor and our Bathroom was Large and very well decorated. The PC in the room was on the blink but apart from that all else was working. The Breakfast was good and the Coffee was as you can expect in Italy , very nice. The Location is right beside the Spanish steps and Via Condotti and is an ideal location for discovering the most interesting City in the World. I did think the Hotel was very nice and I have been to Rome three times before but on a personal level when I go back again I would prefer a Hotel that fits in with its environment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Fun Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Liz75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Art and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The hotel is ideally located near the Spanish Steps. This means that you are really are in the heart of the city. There are lots of restaurants and shopping areas around. There are always people on and around the Spanish Steps. So it is a fun and lively area. However, the hotel itself is off a peaceful little side street so you can escape from the noise. Most other attractions are close by. The Piazza di Spagna Metro station is also very close so you can conveniently get to the Vatican or any other place you'd like. The Hotel itself has a very unique, artistic decor. To be honest, it is probably either a love it or hate it decor. However, all the floors are color coded. And it was kind of fun to see the floors and walls light up when I walked through the hallway. But it was all very over-the-top and kind of fun. The rooms were average size - but fine by European standards. However, the accomodations were very comfortable. The furnishings were neat and comfortable without being over-the-top (like the rest of the hotel). They served an excellent breakfast in the morning. Also, because it isn't a 'big' hotel, you can have a relaxed breakfast in the morning without feeling like you should leave. I also found the staff very helpful. We were travelling on to other cities in Italy and had forgot to print the locations/phone numbers of our hotels. However, the staff at the Hotel Art were very good about finding this information for us, printing it out, and give us maps to our next cities. Overall, this was a fantastic place that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel Art”
Reviews.Author: CaronSheffield
Reviews.Content: A little gem, small but perfect, quiet back street away from noise and pollution of Rome, staff excellent ,very trendy and exclusive, if you like to be treated with respect and love modern design, then go , you will not be disappointed. Breakfast was delicious as were the cappuccinos! Hint about the air con, it only works if your window is completely shut, we only learned that on our last night. Very good location , amazing shops, Gusto restaurant highly recommended, but go for a drink in the bar as they serve food free of charge if you are drinking!(not cheap). Take a walk to the top of the Spanish steps and go left to the Villa Borghese Park if you want fresh air and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “NIce looks shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: GHNWEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend, booking the hotel directly. The staff were very friendly, pleasant and helpful, booking guides for us on two days to tour the Vatican and Forum area. And the location is perfect to see the city. We booked a suite although it was essentially two small badly designed rooms connected by a sliding door. Not a suite in the accepted definition. We encountered two problems during our stay. First, the noise. The sound proofing is clearly inadequate. We could hear the people in the room next door, which was very intrusive. Our room also looked out into the internal courtyard and even though we were on the fourth floor the noise generated by people in the outside seating area on the ground floor of the courtyard was excessive. The area acted as a massive sound tunnel. The second problem was it was hot. In spite of two discussions with reception there was no change to the room temperature and no offer to turn on the air conditioning. Given the cost of the suite, we would have expected more in terms of guest comfort and we were disappointed. In summary, a great looking hotel but lack of attention to building detail from the perspective of the average guest. A lesson here for hotel architects the world over! Would we stay here again - no.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karintommy
Reviews.Content: We stayes in this hotel from march 8 till march 11. We were impressed by the looks and colors of this hotel, all seemed worked out till perfection, its quite, perfectly situated in an artist gallery street, but only a few steps away from the spanish steps and all te main shopping streets. The room was not very large but was large enough for us and most important well kept, nice beds and perfect shower. Breakfast was great and because it is a small hotel abouth 47 rooms or so, its not crowded at all and you can enjoy your breakfast with a great cup of cappucino in peace and quiet. The people working at the hotel were all very nice friendly and helpfull. Dinner we had at the "ristorante al la Rampa"near the Spanish steps and we can recomment it to all. Nexy time in Rome we definitly come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: vickycg77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our two week honeymoon in Rome and decided to stay somewhere more modern, after spending time in rustic Tuscany. The Hotel Art was so accomodating and gracious upon check in. The room was spacious and well maintained - we were on the orange floor. We even opted for a private car to tour the city - highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: TryW
Reviews.Content: Hotel Art served as a sophisticated, well designed refuge during our week in Rome. The location cannot be beat: a quiet, art and design filled street that is steps from the activity of the Spanish Steps and a Metro stop. The Hotel had lovely, thoughtful features, surprises every time a door opened. The finishes were sleek and well detailed, the room had every comfort, and even sleeping with the windows open in the cool Fall air was a treat in the quiet location. The staff were helpful and attentive. Bed linens and toiletries were beautiful and luxurious! For a seasoned traveler, this is terrific find. For a novice, what a great introduction to Rome! We booked almost six months ahead and got a very competitive rate, the full breakfast and total comfort made the hotel a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, used to be trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyfrog
Reviews.Content: I have spent two weeks in this hotel in two different stays. The two times the staff at the reception was very rude: the first time they gave me a single room instead of double, arguing that the hotel was fully booked... 20 mn of negociations latter I have a double room... The second time, they gave me a room which seemed to be among the oldest one (broken tiles in the bathroom, strange smell and strange stains in the room...) just in front of the elevator. I did not slept at all as the hotel was quite noisy this night and the rooms' walls very thin. The same excuse was given... More than 400 EUR for this hotel is really not worth a cent!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melem
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel as beautiful as its photographs on the Internet. Our room and bathroom, although on the small side, were beautifully appointed and well maintained by the the staff. Its location (close to the Spanish steps and Via Condotti) was ideal for exploring new and old Rome on foot, and having been a Seminary, its thick walls and quiet off the main street setting afforded us a good night's sleep too.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: riobrasil
Reviews.Content: My wife and me booked the hotel for 3 nights. The location is perfect! Via margutta is a very charming street and although it is close to the main tourist attractions in rome, it is very silent at night. The staff is very nice and helpfull. The rooms have a decent size and the bathroom is larger than we thought. The furniture is very cool and breakfast is fine and served in a very original room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Sailgirl22
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we stayed at in all of Italy. We were in Rome twice during the trip, first time stayed at the Borgognoni but once we got to Hotel Art wished we had stayed here the entire time. Great vibe, stylish decor, chic rooms, cool people. Fantastic location. Our only gripe was not having complete control over the temperature of our room. The front desk had to be contacted to enable the air conditioning to be set at a lower temperature. For $330 / euros per night setting the temperature of your environment should be easier. Other than that, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected it to be”
Reviews.Author: Minite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art in May this year, we had reserved one double bedroom at 320.00 Euros (approx 410.00 US$) and one single bedroom at 200.00 Euros (approx. 255 US$) for one night. The location is absolutely ideal: via Margutta is a very quiet street near Piazza di Spania and at reasonable walking distance from almost everything one wishes to see while in Rome. We had also reserved a private limo airport transfer from the airport with the hotel. The driver was an extremely pleasant gentleman. The problem is that he could not find us at the meeting point he said, although our plane had not been delayed and we had been waiting for several minutes. The other problem is that he had parked his car in the public parking of the airport which obliged us to walk to the car with our suitcases for 5 minutes, which is not what you expect from a costly private transfer. Welcome at reception was just polite, not very friendly. We had been confirmed an early check in and late check out by e-mail and when we arrived at the hotel this was not true. We did not bother to ask if we could stay a bit longer than the official check out time on the next day. On more than one occasion, we had to wait until the person at reception eventually finished their private phone conversations before taking us into consideration. The double bedroom was an average size, the bathroom average size also with a large bath tub and shower. The single bedroom was actually VERY small with almost no space around the bed. The bedrooms furniture is worn out and there were black marks on the floors and walls. The hallway, lounge and breakfast area (which are the same space) are not as spacious as they look on their website, actually they are very small and also, same comment about their furniture and walls: worn out and stained. Prices are much too high and this hotel is definitely not the category it sells itself. We shall not return to this hotel, it is much too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days at the beginning of our extended Italian vacation. When we arrived, we were shown to a room that seemed nice and we were told we were given a complementary upgrade- seemed nice of them until we left and relized why- construction going on literally RIGHT NEXT TO THE ROOM meant CONSTANT jackhammering!!! Not random hammering, jackhammering. We asked to be moved and they did so, without a problem- we came back downstairs and they didn't even need us to say anything, they said "we'll switch your room"- seems like they had had a problem pawning that room off on other guests as well. Our second room seemed fine, but literally was so tiny there was no room to move. NO place for suitcases AT ALL- we had to completely repack everything each night just to have room to walk. The bathroom was ridiculous. The shower was large enough to stand upright in- ladies- forget shaving your legs while staying at the Hotel Art!! Now here's the thing- I wrote ALL of this off on the size being just "how European rooms are" but the next 3 hotels we stayed at on our trip in other cities- which we paid EXACTLY the same amount for per night as at Hotel Art- disproved that theory with their spacious rooms and bathrooms. DO NOT SETTLE FOR THIS PLACE! It is not worth the money. Their neon-looking hallways looked nothing like in the pics, either- expect, dirty, black scuffed floors and walls. The kicker was, however, when we checked out.
