We were told it would take 5 minutes for a taxi- when one did not show for THIRTY MINTUES- I went back in (after asking them to re-call the taxi company 2 previous times) and demanded they do something as we were going to miss our train- and they looked at me and told me, shrugged his shoulders, and said "Sorry, nothing I can do" WHAT???? 330 euro a night and they cant even help you get in a taxi. They also have only a few people that speak good English, so it got to be kind of difficult at times. We rebooked at Exedra for our final nights in Rome and, for the same price, had a room three times as large and MUCH nicer staff, with a complemetary Mercedes to the airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great staff, set us up with a guide for the Vatican and ancient Rome. Ample and fresh breakfast buffet, great coffee. Imaculately clean room, a little small, but who stay's in the room? Very comfortable, got great night's sleep. Quiet location, plenty of restaurants, shops and sights within minutes walk. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It is truly a slice of Heaven in the heart of rome - Bassing, New Jersey USA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I describe this as a Heavenly experience, not only because it is a converted church, but because the staff, beautiful Danish design of simplicity and attentiveness to even the smallest of details is sheer perfection. My family has stayed there in 04/06 and we just returned from there in June of this year (06). We brought 3 other people to join us this trip (party of 6 in all) and they were blown away !!! Myself and another quest are interior design consultants and she had a lot of fun taking pictures for family and friends. The large spacious rooms, that are spotless, are so inviting along with a wonderful array of specially designed toiletries made specifcally for the Art, perfectly made comfortable beds with real linen sheets, wonderful fluffy robes and slippers, large closet space with a safe that accually operates and is simple to use, make it almost hard to leave and do the sites of this fabulous city. The personnel perform with perfection and are always pleasantly smiling. Don't forget to have a drink with Maurizio at the bar. He is thoroughly charming, speaks many languages, and THEE MAN to go to for any information or suggestions. (Quite a character to say the least). Upon my next visit to Rome, there will be no other place I could possibly stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After I booked it I'd read some bad reviews so was a bit worried about the small rooms and noisey floors as I'm a light sleeper. However, I needn't have worried this was an amzing hotel! Very central, small but comfortable room with a soft bed and very crisp sheets. The hotel bar/breakfast room was stunning and the corrdorrs were truely unique. I always like to stay somewhere a bit differnt to the norm and if you like boutique this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: allylondon
Reviews.Content: Stylish, chic and modern small(ish) hotel on a quiet and pretty side street only 5 mins from the Piazza di Spagna (and even closer to the shops on Via Condotti!). We had a spacious, very clean room, with fabulous bed linen (actually linen, not cotton - wonderful), a reasonable sized bathroom with decent shower, huge bed and great little touches like big fluffy bathrobes. The hotel was beautifully quiet - no traffic noise at all. Staff were charming and helpful, and arranged dinner at a fabulous restaurant with very little notice. Great breakfast with loads of options (and great coffee!). Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Roseybud73
Reviews.Content: Situated in a small cobbled street, a minute's walk away from the Spanish Steps, this hotel is in a fantastic location, ideal for those wishing to go sightseeing/shopping. Good buffet breakfast, friendly English speaking staff and smart rooms/plush bathrooms. Slight negatives would be: Some rooms are pretty small (ours was one of the bigger ones - no. 304 overlooking the entrance walkway). Corridors were a little noisy (stone floors plus piped-in Musik). No evening restaurant (although they do offer a limited range of room service items, and there are lots of great restaurants within a couple of minutes walk). That said, I would certainly recommend this smart hotel and would stay there again at the drop of a hat!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish & great location!”
Reviews.Author: ganglypete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Average size room but excellently fitted out - large bed, lovely linen, well stocked fridge, stylish bathroom with sliding glass doors. Upon arrival the room was set with a complimentary bowl of fruit, bathrobes & slippers. Great buffet breakfast (fruit, meats, cheeses, rolls, pastries, cereals, yoghurt). Set within a small cobbled street, lined with antique shops (and Prada on the corner). Apparently it's the same street featured in the film Roman Holiday (where Gregory Peck has his apartment!). Literally 3 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps. Whilst the hotel doesn't have it's own restaurant offering evening meals, there are numerous great, reasonably priced restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. Staff were great, as was the room service (the beds were turned down each evening and small sachets of night cream were left on the pillows). All in all, a great stay at a funky hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Art was lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Art. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms, while somewhat astere, were very comfortable and clean. We were traveling with 2 teenagers and they loved their room and the brightly colored hallways. The location was ideal - very centrally located to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reactions to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPOBOB
Reviews.Content: Let me start on the positive. The location is excellent - subway nearby, good shopping and restaurants in the neighborhood, walking distance to many of the major attractions and quiet. Additionally, the bed was very comfortable and the linens were excellent and well laundered and the shower while small had good water pressure and lots of hot water. We had breakfast included which was more than adequate and the wait staff was friendly and effecient. The negatives: the room we had was extremely small such that there was inadequate space to store luggage meaning we were always navigating around it and there was nowhere to sit except on the bed. We were there when the temperature was in the 90's and the air conditioning was inadequate (one of those new energy mangement systems that automatically turns off when you leave the room) such that the room was constantly too hot and certainly no escape from the heat of the city. Further, our room was on an interior air shaft such that it was impossible to get any outside ventialtion and the room was very dark. (A room with an oustside exposure would no doubt be better). We found the desk and concierge staff to be mixed. One young lady tried very hard to be helpful, but the rest seemed to be put off by our questions and not very knowledgeable about tours or how to do anything that was not in the general vacinity. No real "insider suggestions". In retrospect, we wondered if this was in part do to the fact that they had limited ability to speak English nonetheless whatever the reason they were not helpful. I also found their restaurant suggestions generally to be for places that were overpriced. All in all a mixed experience and we would probably be inclined to try something else the next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kynasf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in July as part of our 2 week honeymoon in Italy. I cannot understand the negative comments about this place as we found it to be an excellent hotel. All the hotel staff were very friendly during our stay. We even got bongiorno's from the cleaners when we passed them in the corridors. The concierge was excellent. Very good knowledge of the restaurants in Rome. They made a reservation for us at Gusto which proved to be one of the best meals we had in Rome. They also gave us some great information on bars and nightlife, and also pointed out to us that the museum we were planning to visit that day was closed, saving us a wasted journey. Our room wasn't exactly large, but very clean, modern and comfortable. The decor makes a refreshing change to the usual austere places you might find in Rome. The only problem is noise from the corridors which being a modern hotel are hard floors, not carpet. The clatter of other guests stiletto's at 2am one night highlighted this, but it's only a minor niggle. The location was excellent, very close to many of the sights and all the upmarket shops, but situated in a very quiet, cobbled backstreet. Overall, we would highly recommend this place to those looking for a modern twist on the tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akssms
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by some of the comments here. I stayed with my wife for 3 nights and found this hotel to be excellent. I agree that it is relatively expensive but in return you get a great location, friendly and helpful staff combined with modern features. The rooms are small but very comfortable. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Art”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, mod contemporary design created within old church nave - helpful staff, spotless rooms, we had 2 windows, great little bathrooms with towel warmers, robes, slippers - excellent location in antiques district by the Spanish Steps

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel overpriced but good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome soon LUCKY YOU-fantastic city .This Hotel is very expensive £190 a night when I went NOV 04.WOW was I dissappointed dreadful reception staff ,awfully small rooms ,I hated it .Breakfast rubbish ,souless bar in the hotel .I know its location is a short walk from the Spainish steps but this hotel is not worth the premium.I'm going back to Rome in the summer but will look for a better hotel.Honestly this hotel is very poor value with staff having no local knowledge of restaurants ,bars to recommend .There are better hotels out there.Finally the hotel photos on their site are very misleading its not funky just very cold and souless.GIVE IT A MISS

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this gem of a hotel. I don't understand the negative comments by some reviewers. It's an inspired restoration of a beautiful old building that is now a stylish and modern, 100% chintz-free alternative to the traditional hotel. Ok, the rooms aren't huge, but our de-luxe was both comfortable and roomy, well-designed and well-furnished. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful - and we don't speak any Italian. The location is as good as it gets in Rome - surrounded by galleries and top designer shops, on a stunning and quiet sidestreet only a few minutes walk from the Spanish Steps. If you want flowery wallpapers, velvet drapes, antique furniture, gilded mirrors and repro-renaissance art, then this hotel is not for you. If you want someting different in a great location at a reasonable price (for Rome), then try the Art Hotel. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an extended weekend stay in Rome at Hotel Art. Initially impressed with the hotel's trendy design, things went downhill from here. Overall service, from the check-in staff to the waiters and chambermaids, with minor exceptions, thrived on a need to aggrandize themselves at our expense. A request for shampoo was met with: "Why do you need shampoo?" The rooms were small, efficiently designed, altough stuffy -- even though there are indiviudal room controls for ventilation and a/c, they are all controlled centrally from the reception!? At times, the temperature and ventilation was unbearable, and we needed to have the window open -- cannot imagine what it would be like during the summer with the heat. Also, the gym, is not really a gym, more so, 3 pieces of cardio equipment. Having said all that, location was great, breakfast substantial with scrambled eggs (extra charge) out of this world. Overall, I'd think twice before booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Hotel Art”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Art was TERRIBLE!!!!! We were there in June and were supposed to stay for 3 nights. We left after the first night because the A/C was broken (they blamed it on it just being hot in Rome), the elevator was broken, and to top it all, when we got back to our room at 4pm it had still not been made up. And of course, they had a terrible attitude about it all. Bottom line, STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Creative, Clever, but not Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: American_in_Italy
Reviews.Content: I am an American living in Italy. I found this hotel very different from the norm in Italy - some positive things, some negative. Positives: High tech features in the room (hair dryer with real power, lighting adjustable, sliding door to bathroom), location great, nice amenities in room, breakfast a lot of good food to choose from. Negatives: noisy (in the sense that there is no carpeting at all, 'cement like' hallways so you hear every guest entering), no restaurant in hotel, the phone service stopped working for about 24 hours so I couldn't access email (I was there on business & personal) electronic key card stopped working a few times, Staff not too helpful and inconsistent in accuracy (eg I asked for a reservation at a Japanese restaurant - when we got there it had been changed into a pizzeria), BUT they got me great seats at Cirque de Soleil. Even speaking in Italian, I got the feeling that I was being an 'ugly American'. I agree that the matress was not very comfy, and the room was equal size to most cruise ship cabins. I would try another hotel in the same location next time!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel on a nice street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on rave reviews on Trip Advisor. But, how wrong the reviews seem to be! Rome was perfect! The street (Via Margutta) was wonderful! The Hotel Art, however, was one big disappointment after another. The staff were unfriendly where simple requests were met with eye rolling and sighs. The concierge made one poor recommendation after another - thankfully we befriended others around Rome who made more successful recommendations. The "boutique" hotel theme that works so well in LA, Miami, and NY works only because the staff are hooked in to the local nightlife, enertainment, and restaurants. This place has the "look" but not the local knowledge, nor the service to back it up. The Hotel Art gets the big thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a classy area”
Reviews.Author: Contenta
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find this little gem in Rome right next to the Piazza Espanola (Splanish Steps.) It is on the upscale art gallery street. Our room was on the smallish side even though we had paid more for an upgraded room. We found out that that the rooms on the left side when you step out of the elevator are larger...like rooms 304 and 305. We were told that we would be getting an upgraded room and even paid extra for it, but didn't get one. We had a very small, but clean and tidy room....301. I liked all their amenities from slippers, bath robes to hair dryer to soaps, etc. They had it all. We were only there for one night passing through and if we had been there for more nights we would have asked for an 04 or 05 room. We definately would stay there again asking specifically for a larger room. The atmosphere was very different; in an old abbey and very "out there". It has quite a history and actually the bar used to be the alter area of this abbey. Each floor had a different color. We were on the orange floor and the floor lit up when you stepped off of the elevator. The staff was warm, friendly and very helpful. They have a web site that doesn't do it much justice.
